channel.title: Philip's Slackblog on
channel.description: Recent content in Philip's Slackblog on

item.description: #natural-anchors #rigging #rigging-concepts Evaluating Boulders as Anchors Introduction Boulder wraps are a very common form of highline anchor, but require more knowledge than bolt or tree anchors.

item.title: Double Wrapped Grogs
item.description: Double Wrapped Grog Splices A double wrapped 5mm grog connection made and photographed by Clayton Underwood. Double wrapped grogs are a very strong connector.

item.title: Factors Influencing Choice of Split Connections
item.description: Factors Influencing Choice of Split Connections There are many ways of making split connections on highlines, with no single method clearly considered “best” by the community.

item.title: Farmer Boy 5mm Diamond Braid Full Break Tests
item.description: Complete Farmer Boy Diamond Braid Breaktests Main Test Below are the full 56 break tests of Farmer Boy 5mm diamond braid polyester cord.

item.title: Farmer Boy 5mm Diamond Braid in Knots and Devices
item.description: Testing Farmer Boy 5mm Diamond Braid Polyester Cord in Knots and Devices Introduction Farmer Boy 5mm diamond braid polyester cord is a commonly used highline tagline in the United States.

item.title: Grog Splice Full Break Tests
item.description: Complete Grog Breaktests Main Test These are the unedited values for the 20 breaktests of grog splices completed in June 2022.

item.title: Grog Splices
item.description: Grog Splices Grog splices are a new method of connecting split highlines, but have already gained fans for being the lowest volume split connector.

item.title: Pull Rope 6mm Double Braid Full Break Tests
item.description: Complete 6mm Pull Rope Double Braid Breaktests Main Test Below are the full 65 break tests of SGT Knots 6mm Double Braid Pull Rope.

item.title: Pull Rope 6mm Double Braid in Knots and Devices
item.description: Testing Pull Rope 6mm Double Braid Polyester Cord in Knots and Devices Introduction Double Braid 6mm Pull Rope from SGT Knots is a high strength and relatively inexpensive tagline that has been used as the final tagline for a number of 500m+ projects in the US over the past few years.

item.title: Splicing Grogs On Site
item.description: Splicing Grogs on Site In my original post about grog splices, I said it took about 10 minutes to splice a full connection in the field.
